1use std::collections::{BTreeMap, BTreeSet};
2use std::fmt;
3
4use crate::compiler::instructions::Instructions;
5use crate::environment::Environment;
6use crate::error::{Error, ErrorKind};
7use crate::output::Output;
8use crate::template::Template;
9use crate::utils::{AutoEscape, UndefinedBehavior};
10use crate::value::{ArgType, Value};
11use crate::vm::context::Context;
12
13#[cfg(feature = "fuel")]
14use crate::vm::fuel::FuelTracker;
15
16/// When macros are used, the state carries an `id` counter.  Whenever a state is
17/// created, the counter is incremented.  This exists because macros can keep a reference
18/// to instructions from another state by index.  Without this counter it would
19/// be possible for a macro to be called with a different state (different id)
20/// which mean we likely panic.
21#[cfg(feature = "macros")]
22static STATE_ID: std::sync::atomic::AtomicIsize = std::sync::atomic::AtomicIsize::new(0);
23
24/// Provides access to the current execution state of the engine.
25///
26/// A read only reference is passed to filter functions and similar objects to
27/// allow limited interfacing with the engine.  The state is useful to look up
28/// information about the engine in filter, test or global functions.  It not
29/// only provides access to the template environment but also the context
30/// variables of the engine, the current auto escaping behavior as well as the
31/// auto escape flag.
32///
33/// In some testing scenarios or more advanced use cases you might need to get
34/// a [`State`].  The state is managed as part of the template execution but the
35/// initial state can be retrieved via [`Template::new_state`](crate::Template::new_state).
36/// The most common way to get hold of the state however is via functions of filters.
37///
38/// **Notes on lifetimes:** the state object exposes some of the internal
39/// lifetimes through the type.  You should always elide these lifetimes
40/// as there might be lifetimes added or removed between releases.
41pub struct State<'template, 'env> {
42    pub(crate) env: &'env Environment<'env>,
43    pub(crate) ctx: Context<'env>,
44    pub(crate) current_block: Option<&'env str>,
45    pub(crate) auto_escape: AutoEscape,
46    pub(crate) instructions: &'template Instructions<'env>,
47    pub(crate) blocks: BTreeMap<&'env str, BlockStack<'template, 'env>>,
48    #[allow(unused)]
49    pub(crate) loaded_templates: BTreeSet<&'env str>,
50    #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
51    pub(crate) id: isize,
52    #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
53    pub(crate) macros: std::sync::Arc<Vec<(&'template Instructions<'env>, usize)>>,
54    #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
55    pub(crate) closure_tracker: std::sync::Arc<crate::vm::closure_object::ClosureTracker>,
56    #[cfg(feature = "fuel")]
57    pub(crate) fuel_tracker: Option<std::sync::Arc<FuelTracker>>,
58}
59
60impl<'template, 'env> fmt::Debug for State<'template, 'env> {
61    fn fmt(&self, f: &mut fmt::Formatter<'_>) -> fmt::Result {
62        let mut ds = f.debug_struct("State");
63        ds.field("name", &self.instructions.name());
64        ds.field("current_block", &self.current_block);
65        ds.field("auto_escape", &self.auto_escape);
66        ds.field("ctx", &self.ctx);
67        ds.field("env", &self.env);
68        ds.finish()
69    }
70}
71
72impl<'template, 'env> State<'template, 'env> {
73    /// Creates a new state.
74    pub(crate) fn new(
75        env: &'env Environment,
76        ctx: Context<'env>,
77        auto_escape: AutoEscape,
78        instructions: &'template Instructions<'env>,
79        blocks: BTreeMap<&'env str, BlockStack<'template, 'env>>,
80    ) -> State<'template, 'env> {
81        State {
82            #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
83            id: STATE_ID.fetch_add(1, std::sync::atomic::Ordering::Relaxed),
84            env,
85            ctx,
86            current_block: None,
87            auto_escape,
88            instructions,
89            blocks,
90            loaded_templates: BTreeSet::new(),
91            #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
92            macros: Default::default(),
93            #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
94            closure_tracker: Default::default(),
95            #[cfg(feature = "fuel")]
96            fuel_tracker: env.fuel().map(FuelTracker::new),
97        }
98    }
99
100    /// Creates an empty state for an environment.
101    pub(crate) fn new_for_env(env: &'env Environment) -> State<'env, 'env> {
102        State::new(
103            env,
104            Context::new(env.recursion_limit()),
105            AutoEscape::None,
106            &crate::compiler::instructions::EMPTY_INSTRUCTIONS,
107            BTreeMap::new(),
108        )
109    }
110
111    /// Returns a reference to the current environment.
112    #[inline(always)]
113    pub fn env(&self) -> &Environment<'_> {
114        self.env
115    }
116
117    /// Returns the name of the current template.
118    pub fn name(&self) -> &str {
119        self.instructions.name()
120    }
121
122    /// Returns the current value of the auto escape flag.
123    #[inline(always)]
124    pub fn auto_escape(&self) -> AutoEscape {
125        self.auto_escape
126    }
127
128    /// Returns the current undefined behavior.
129    #[inline(always)]
130    pub fn undefined_behavior(&self) -> UndefinedBehavior {
131        self.env.undefined_behavior()
132    }
133
134    /// Returns the name of the innermost block.
135    #[inline(always)]
136    pub fn current_block(&self) -> Option<&str> {
137        self.current_block
138    }
139
140    /// Looks up a variable by name in the context.
141    #[inline(always)]
142    pub fn lookup(&self, name: &str) -> Option<Value> {
143        self.ctx.load(self.env, name)
144    }
145
146    /// Looks up a global macro and calls it.
147    ///
148    /// This looks up a value as [`lookup`](Self::lookup) does and calls it
149    /// with the passed args.
150    #[cfg(feature = "macros")]
151    #[cfg_attr(docsrs, doc(cfg(feature = "macros")))]
152    pub fn call_macro(&self, name: &str, args: &[Value]) -> Result<String, Error> {
153        let f = ok!(self.lookup(name).ok_or_else(|| Error::new(
154            crate::error::ErrorKind::UnknownFunction,
155            "macro not found"
156        )));
157        f.call(self, args).map(Into::into)
158    }
159
160    /// Renders a block with the given name into a string.
161    ///
162    /// This method works like [`Template::render`](crate::Template::render) but
163    /// it only renders a specific block in the template.  The first argument is
164    /// the name of the block.
165    ///
166    /// This renders only the block `hi` in the template:
167    ///
168    /// ```
169    /// # use minijinja::{Environment, context};
170    /// # fn test() -> Result<(), minijinja::Error> {
171    /// # let mut env = Environment::new();
172    /// # env.add_template("hello", "{% block hi %}Hello {{ name }}!{% endblock %}")?;
173    /// let tmpl = env.get_template("hello")?;
174    /// let rv = tmpl
175    ///     .eval_to_state(context!(name => "John"))?
176    ///     .render_block("hi")?;
177    /// println!("{}", rv);
178    /// # Ok(()) }
179    /// ```
180    ///
181    /// Note that rendering a block is a stateful operation.  If an error
182    /// is returned the module has to be re-created as the internal state
183    /// can end up corrupted.  This also means you can only render blocks
184    /// if you have a mutable reference to the state which is not possible
185    /// from within filters or similar.
186    #[cfg(feature = "multi_template")]
187    #[cfg_attr(docsrs, doc(cfg(feature = "multi_template")))]
188    pub fn render_block(&mut self, block: &str) -> Result<String, Error> {
189        let mut buf = String::new();
190        crate::vm::Vm::new(self.env)
191            .call_block(block, self, &mut Output::with_string(&mut buf))
192            .map(|_| buf)
193    }
194
195    /// Renders a block with the given name into an [`io::Write`](std::io::Write).
196    ///
197    /// For details see [`render_block`](Self::render_block).
198    #[cfg(feature = "multi_template")]
199    #[cfg_attr(docsrs, doc(cfg(feature = "multi_template")))]
200    pub fn render_block_to_write<W>(&mut self, block: &str, w: W) -> Result<(), Error>
201    where
202        W: std::io::Write,
203    {
204        let mut wrapper = crate::output::WriteWrapper { w, err: None };
205        crate::vm::Vm::new(self.env)
206            .call_block(block, self, &mut Output::with_write(&mut wrapper))
207            .map(|_| ())
208            .map_err(|err| wrapper.take_err(err))
209    }
210
211    /// Returns a list of the names of all exports (top-level variables).
212    pub fn exports(&self) -> Vec<&str> {
213        self.ctx.exports().keys().copied().collect()
214    }
215
216    /// Fetches a template by name with path joining.
217    ///
218    /// This works like [`Environment::get_template`] with the difference that the lookup
219    /// undergoes path joining.  If the environment has a configured path joining callback,
220    /// it will be invoked with the name of the current template as parent template.
221    ///
222    /// For more information see [`Environment::set_path_join_callback`].
223    pub fn get_template(&self, name: &str) -> Result<Template<'env, 'env>, Error> {
224        self.env
225            .get_template(&self.env.join_template_path(name, self.name()))
226    }
227
228    /// Invokes a filter with some arguments.
229    ///
230    /// ```
231    /// # use minijinja::Environment;
232    /// # let mut env = Environment::new();
233    /// # env.add_filter("upper", |x: &str| x.to_uppercase());
234    /// # let tmpl = env.template_from_str("").unwrap();
235    /// # let state = tmpl.new_state();
236    /// let rv = state.apply_filter("upper", &["hello world".into()]).unwrap();
237    /// assert_eq!(rv.as_str(), Some("HELLO WORLD"));
238    /// ```
239    pub fn apply_filter(&self, filter: &str, args: &[Value]) -> Result<Value, Error> {
240        match self.env.get_filter(filter) {
241            Some(filter) => filter.apply_to(self, args),
242            None => Err(Error::from(ErrorKind::UnknownFilter)),
243        }
244    }
245
246    /// Invokes a test function on a value.
247    ///
248    /// ```
249    /// # use minijinja::Environment;
250    /// # let mut env = Environment::new();
251    /// # env.add_test("even", |x: i32| x % 2 == 0);
252    /// # let tmpl = env.template_from_str("").unwrap();
253    /// # let state = tmpl.new_state();
254    /// let rv = state.perform_test("even", &[42i32.into()]).unwrap();
255    /// assert!(rv);
256    /// ```
257    pub fn perform_test(&self, test: &str, args: &[Value]) -> Result<bool, Error> {
258        match self.env.get_test(test) {
259            Some(test) => test.perform(self, args),
260            None => Err(Error::from(ErrorKind::UnknownTest)),
261        }
262    }
263
264    /// Formats a value to a string using the formatter on the environment.
265    ///
266    /// ```
267    /// # use minijinja::{value::Value, Environment};
268    /// # let mut env = Environment::new();
269    /// # let tmpl = env.template_from_str("").unwrap();
270    /// # let state = tmpl.new_state();
271    /// let rv = state.format(Value::from(42)).unwrap();
272    /// assert_eq!(rv, "42");
273    /// ```
274    pub fn format(&self, value: Value) -> Result<String, Error> {
275        let mut rv = String::new();
276        let mut out = Output::with_string(&mut rv);
277        self.env.format(&value, self, &mut out).map(|_| rv)
278    }
279
280    /// Returns the fuel levels.
281    ///
282    /// When the fuel feature is enabled, during evaluation the template will keep
283    /// track of how much fuel it has consumed.  If the fuel tracker is turned on
284    /// the returned value will be `Some((consumed, remaining))`.  If fuel tracking
285    /// is not enabled, `None` is returned instead.
286    #[cfg(feature = "fuel")]
287    #[cfg_attr(docsrs, doc(cfg(feature = "fuel")))]
288    pub fn fuel_levels(&self) -> Option<(u64, u64)> {
289        self.fuel_tracker
290            .as_ref()
291            .map(|x| (x.consumed(), x.remaining()))
292    }
293
294    #[cfg(feature = "debug")]
295    pub(crate) fn make_debug_info(
296        &self,
297        pc: usize,
298        instructions: &Instructions<'_>,
299    ) -> crate::debug::DebugInfo {
300        crate::debug::DebugInfo {
301            template_source: Some(instructions.source().to_string()),
302            referenced_locals: instructions
303                .get_referenced_names(pc)
304                .into_iter()
305                .filter_map(|n| Some((n.to_string(), some!(self.lookup(n)))))
306                .collect(),
307        }
308    }
309}
310
311impl<'a> ArgType<'a> for &State<'_, '_> {
312    type Output = &'a State<'a, 'a>;
313
314    fn from_value(_value: Option<&'a Value>) -> Result<Self::Output, Error> {
315        Err(Error::new(
316            ErrorKind::InvalidOperation,
317            "cannot use state type in this position",
318        ))
319    }
320
321    fn from_state_and_value(
322        state: Option<&'a State>,
323        _value: Option<&'a Value>,
324    ) -> Result<(Self::Output, usize), Error> {
325        match state {
326            None => Err(Error::new(ErrorKind::InvalidOperation, "state unavailable")),
327            Some(state) => Ok((state, 0)),
328        }
329    }
330}
331
332/// Tracks a block and it's parents for super.
333#[derive(Default)]
334pub(crate) struct BlockStack<'template, 'env> {
335    instructions: Vec<&'template Instructions<'env>>,
336    depth: usize,
337}
338
339impl<'template, 'env> BlockStack<'template, 'env> {
340    pub fn new(instructions: &'template Instructions<'env>) -> BlockStack<'template, 'env> {
341        BlockStack {
342            instructions: vec![instructions],
343            depth: 0,
344        }
345    }
346
347    pub fn instructions(&self) -> &'template Instructions<'env> {
348        self.instructions.get(self.depth).copied().unwrap()
349    }
350
351    pub fn push(&mut self) -> bool {
352        if self.depth + 1 < self.instructions.len() {
353            self.depth += 1;
354            true
355        } else {
356            false
357        }
358    }
359
360    #[track_caller]
361    pub fn pop(&mut self) {
362        self.depth = self.depth.checked_sub(1).unwrap()
363    }
364
365    #[cfg(feature = "multi_template")]
366    pub fn append_instructions(&mut self, instructions: &'template Instructions<'env>) {
367        self.instructions.push(instructions);
368    }
369}
